intro: Viguiera coraniana, commonly known as Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and coneflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bright orange to red composite flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Viguiera coraniana is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
